thread.title: Another truck slams into B.C. overpass, snarling Hwy 99 traffic in Delta
thread.title_full: Another truck slams into B.C. overpass, snarling Hwy 99 traffic in Delta

author: Canadian Press Videos
title: Another truck slams into B.C. overpass, snarling Hwy 99 traffic in Delta
text:
CBC Another truck slams into B.C. overpass, snarling Hwy 99 traffic in Delta Read full article CBC December 29, 2023 at 1:29 a.m. Â· 2 min read A truck smashed into an overpass in Delta, B.C., shutting down the southbound lanes of Highway 99 on Dec. 28, 2023. (Submitted by Alexmosv Molina/X - image credit) A truck carrying what appears to be heavy construction material smashed into an overpass in Delta, B.C., on Thursday, shutting down the southbound lanes of Highway 99.
It's the latest in a rash of overpass collisions that prompted the province to announce harsher penalties for companies and drivers with repeat offences earlier this month.
B.C.'s Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure called Thursday's collision "frustrating," saying "the issue needs to stop."
Drive BC says the incident south of Vancouver has blocked traffic in both directions on the 112th Street overpass.
Delta Fire and Rescue Deputy Chief Dave Wood says the crash caused a "secondary accident'' involving another vehicle.
He says crews were called to the scene at 12:14 p.m. and he didn't know of any injuries.
The ministry did not name the company involved, but said its Commercial Vehicle Safety and Enforcement branch is suspending the company's ability to operate in B.C. while an investigation is underway.
"It's frustrating to hear that another commercial vehicle driver has crashed into provincial highway infrastructure," a ministry spokesperson said in an email.
The ministry said a maintenance contractor's initial assessment "appears to show significant damage to the overpass."
"When these crashes occur, they have a huge impact: they delay commuters, affect the movement of goods and can impede first responders," the statement said.
Firefighters attend an collision scene Thursday on Highway 99 in Delta, B.C., below the 112 Street overpass, the latest to be struck by a semi-truck. Firefighters attend an collision scene Thursday on Highway 99 in Delta, B.C., below the 112 Street overpass. Provincial statistics say as many as 30 bridge strikes have happened on B.C. highways since 2021, with 16 of them reported last year alone. (Shane MacKichan)
WATCH | The scene on Highway 99 in Delta, B.C., where a semi-truck hit the 112 Street overpass:
Photos of the aftermath of the incident reviewed by CBC News show large girders on the bed of a truck with another laying across the highway along with other debris.
Story continues Provincial statistics say as many as 30 bridge strikes have happened on British Columbia's highways since 2021, with 16 of them reported last year alone.
The new rules, announced Dec. 14, include the requirement for dump-style vehicles to have in-cab warning devices by next June, telling drivers if their trailer hasn't been lowered.
Over-height vehicle fines will increase to $575, up from $115.
